Details

Mole balance on PFR:

\(\frac{dF_A}{dV} = -k\,C_A\)

\(C_A = \frac{F_A}{v_0}\)

where \(k\) = the rate constant (s−1)

\(V\) = the reactor volume (L)

\(C_A\) = the reactant concentration (mol/L)

\(F_A\) = the reactant molar flow rate (mol/s)

\(C_{A,f}\) = reactant fresh feed concentration (mol/L)

\(C_{A,0}\) = reactant feed concentration at PFR inlet (mol/L)

\(C_{A,e}\) = reactant concentration at PFR exit (mol/L)

\(v_f\) = fresh feed volumetric flow rate (L/s)

\(v_0\) = the volumetric flow rate at PFR inlet (L/s)

\(R\) = recycle ratio = \(\frac{v_R}{v_f}\)

\(v_R\) = recycle steam volumetric flow rate (L/s)

\(v_0 = v_f + v_R\)

\(v_0 = v_f\,(R + 1)\)

\(C_{A0,\text{guess}}\) = guessed reactant concentration at PFR inlet (mol/L); this is guessed using the slider

\(C_{A,f,\text{calc}} = C_{A0,\text{guess}}\,(R + 1) - R\,C_{A,e}\) = calculated fresh feed concentration from \(C_{A0,\text{guess}}\)

When \(C_{A,f,\text{calc}} = C_{A,f}\), then the correct value of \(C_{A,0}\) has been found.
